info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 6 at 8:19PM EDT by NWS Indianapolis IN
info.description:
...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... Illinois...
Wildcat Creek.
Wabash River.
.Lowland flooding is continuing along the length of the Wabash River due to rainfall of generally three to eight inches in the Wabash basin. Significant flooding is expected to develop on the lower Wabash, with Mount Carmel surpassing moderate flood stage on Monday. The crest on the Wabash was approaching Lafayette this afternoon and is expected to reach Mount Carmel around Saturday April 12.
* WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast.
* WHERE...Wabash River at Vincennes.
* WHEN...Until further notice.
* IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Almost all unprotected areas flood. River cabins are surrounded by high water. Oil fields in lowland areas are inaccessible by land vehicles. Most local river roads flood.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:45 PM EDT Sunday /6:45 PM CDT Sunday/ the stage was 19.0 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:45 PM EDT Sunday /6:45 PM CDT Sunday/ was 19.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 22.0 feet early Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks.
Flooding is occurring or is imminent. Most flood related deaths occur in automobiles. Do not attempt to cross water covered bridges, dips, or low water crossings. Never try to cross a flowing stream, even a small one, on foot. To escape rising water find another route over higher ground.
Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind.
The next statement should be issued by 11 AM Mondaylate tonight by around 230 AM EDT /130 AM CDT/.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE

area.areaDesc: Lawrence, IL; Wabash, IL; Knox, IN
